text: Workflow question from a new here - If using Github for CI, how do folks handle testing out changes? Do you deploy a branch to a test portal? In between the Github-oriented docs and the docs focused on local development, I can't seem to find a clear answer

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>

We suggest in our docs having each dev use a sandbox portal if they need to dev at the same time. You can use github actions to auto deploy branches like main or a develop branch to your production portal or to a shared test portal.

Each team or individual will have different preferences on how they want to set that up. For example if you only have 1 developer they may only care to have the production and testing/develop portal. 

You can adjust the workflow to fit your team and your teams needs.
Thanks Jon! So, we can set up a shared test portal, and use HS actions to deploy a branch to a different test portal, even with the HubSpot Deploy Action set for `main` . That correct?

Im away from computer atm but basically you could make it so merging to a develop branch triggers an auto deploy to your test portal, while a merge to your main branch triggers a deploy to your production portal.

For an individual devs sandbox i just use watch to upload changes
Awesome! Thatâ€™s what I needed! Thank you Jon!

Hey all, i am new to HubSpot and i have a an issue loading some css files and i cant figure it out why, i have a custom html css site that i need to implement in the CMS. On Local the owl carousel is working great but when i put the code to HubSpot the carousel is not working and the code is completely the same i haven't changed anything. i have no idea what's going on. is HubSpot somehow rendering the styles differently ? anyone had some issue like this using owl carousel or something simmular? any help is much welcomed! thanks
